newsitem.title: USA: GOODYEAR TIRE TO BUY PLANT IN GEORGIA.
newsitem.headline: GOODYEAR TIRE TO BUY PLANT IN GEORGIA.

text.p: Goodyear Tire & Rubber Co said it has signed an agreement to purchase Robbins Inc's Ultima Rubber Products plant in Social Circle, Georgia.
Terms of the agreement are not being disclosed.
"This acquisition is another step in our focus on retreading as part of our core businesses," said Eugene R. Culler, executive vice president for North America Tire in a press release.
The 147,000-square-foot Ultima plant, located on a 24-acre site 40 miles east of Atlanta, will significantly increase Goodyear's production of precure rubber for retreading, the company said.
